bill.title: Environmental Impact Statements, Exceptions
bill.description: Temporarily amends Chapter 343, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to clarify current exemptions for secondary actions limited to development within existing public right-of-ways or highways. Requires that applicants prepare environmental assessments when required. Effective January 7, 2059. Repeal on July 1, 2059. (HB2611 HD2)

history.action: (H) Pending introduction.
(H) Introduced and Pass First Reading.
(H) Referred to EEP, JUD, referral sheet 7
(H) Re-referred to TRN, EEP, JUD, referral sheet 9
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by TRN on Wednesday, 02-01-12 9:00AM in House conference room 309.

(H) The committees on TRN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Souki, Ichiyama, Aquino, Cullen, M. Lee, Luke, Takumi, Yamashita, Fontaine, Johanson; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Okamura, Saiki.
(H) Reported from TRN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 129-12), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to EEP.
(H) Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on EEP with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Takai excused (1).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by EEP on Tuesday, 02-14-12 9:00AM in House conference room 325.

(H) The committees on EEP recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 9 Ayes: Representative(s) Coffman, Kawakami, Cabanilla, Chang, Har, Ito, Nakashima; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Carroll, Riviere; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Thielen; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Herkes.
(H) Reported from EEP (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 590-12) as amended in HD 1, recommending referral to JUD.

(H) Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on JUD as amended in HD 1 with Representative(s) Belatti, Ching, Hanohano, Riviere voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Thielen voting no (1) and Representative(s) Herkes, Kawakami, M. Lee, Mizuno, Morikawa excused (5).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 02-21-12 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
(H) The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 03-01-12.
(H) Bill scheduled for decision-making on Thursday, 03-01-12 2:01PM in House conference room 325.

(H) The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 13 Ayes: Keith-Agaran, Rhoads, Brower, Cabanilla, Carroll, Coffman, Ito, Luke, McKelvey, Souki, Tsuji, Fontaine, Marumoto; Ayes with reservations: none; 1 Noes: Thielen; and 1 Excused: Herkes.
(H) Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 917-12) as amended in HD 2, recommending passage on Third Reading.
(H) Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-06-12.

(H) Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Ching voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Hanohano, Riviere, Thielen voting no (3) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 268).
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to ENE.
